Quick Start

For immediate gratification, here is how to launch the application and edit an instrument. After this we will go back and learn the entire editor step-by-step.

Launching the Editor on Windows

  • Open the folder "editor" in the release package.
  • Double click on the "HybridEditor.exe" file.

The Orchestra Window

  • You will see a window open asking you to select a project file. Navigate to the "work/me2000_project.xml" file and click "Open".
  • Wait for the second tab to appear, which may happen very quickly. Click on it. You should now see an Orchestra Editor.
  • Click on the "Hear" buttons for a few instruments to hear their sound. If they use wavetables then they may take several seconds to download into the synthesizer.

Editing an Instrument

  • Click on the "Edit" button in the left hand section next to #8, the "Clav". An editor window will appear.
  • Click on the "Play Keys" button in the top left of the editor window to activate the keyboard.
  • Use your finger to play the letter keys on the left hand side of the ASCII keyboard, for example 'q', 'w', 'e'. Not every key is active.
  • Hold down a key to hear the full evolution of the note.
  • Change the attack rate of the amplitude envelope by moving the "attack" fader at the top right of the window so the value is > 500.
  • Click "Play Keys" button again and hold the 'A' key down. Hear how the instrument rises more slowly.

Exiting the Editor

  • Select "Quit" from the "File" menu or close the main window.
  • You will be asked whether you want to save your changes. Click "Don't Save" because we were just goofing around.

That's it. You have edited an instrument and heard the result. Now to refine our skills.
